current_headlines.headline: The plane landed safely. The event has ended.
After the plane returned to Ben Gurion Airport, security guards checked passenger by passenger. After no unusual findings were found, the event was declared over.

history_headlines.headline: According to the advisor to General Mohsen Rezai, Tel Aviv's threats were not implemented, and Iran did not accept any of the signals transmitted to it. Over the past two weeks, two important messages were transmitted to Iran, and both were rejected. The first message came from the US. Washington made it clear that it intends to carry out a limited strike and expected Tehran to either 'swallow' it or not respond at all. Iran categorically refused, stating that it is revising the rules of war and red lines and will consider any strike as an act of full-scale war. The second message was sent by Israel through intermediaries. It claimed that Israel allegedly would not participate in the US attack, and Iran was asked not to strike Israel. This request also received a negative response. Tehran clearly stated: in case of the start of a US military operation, Israel will become a legitimate target. It is in this context that Netanyahu's latest threats sound. In parallel, Iran sent warnings to all countries in the region - from Baku to Riyadh, stating that any attack from their territory or through their airspace will be considered as an attack by these countries. According to the source, this was the main reason for the cancellation of the planned US strike last Tuesday night. The operation was postponed, and large-scale offensive and defensive forces were transferred to the region. These steps pursue three goals: deterrence, blocking a possible Iranian response, and preparation for an escalation scenario.
history_headlines.keywords: Iran, threats, messages, US, limited, strike, refused, full-scale, war, Israel, legitimate, target, warnings, countries, region, attack, territory, airspace, operation, postponed, forces

history_headlines.headline: Explosive WION report; Why did America step back? Thousands of Iranian missiles and drones, Washington's nightmare! Iran has hundreds of ballistic missiles, cruise missiles and even hypersonic missiles at its disposal and also has thousands of drones. Even the best defense systems are not effective against this volume of attack.
history_headlines.keywords: WION, report, America, step, back, thousands, Iranian, missiles, drones, Washington, nightmare, enemy, ballistic, cruise, hypersonic, defense, systems, attack
